item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket: Best Bibarel ex Deck
item.description:
Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket had endless potential when it comes to the expanding card pool, with new sets being released every couple of months. As these new sets make their way into the game, new cards emerge at the top of the meta and create unique synergies with other new cards and previously released cards through their moves, abilities, and Energy Types.

Bibarel ex is one of many different cards released in Pokemon TCG Pocket's Shining Revelery set. Due to this card's high damage output per turn and solid HP, it makes for one of the best new Colorless Energy Type Ace Pokemon. Plus, Bidoof and Bibarel are both very iconic names in the Pokemon franchise and therefore beloved by many Trainers. If you are one such fan looking to craft the perfect Bibarel ex deck in Pokemon TCG Pocket , everything you'll need to know to do so has been outlined in the guide below.

Best Bibarel ex Deck in Pokemon TCG Pocket, Explained

Bidoof and Bibarel are Colorless Energy Type Pokemon, meaning that they can either play into any Colorless Deck, or slot into any Deck of another Type and utilize that kind of Energy. Bibarel is a great ace Pokemon to play, as it has a very solid 160 HP, which can be further buffed with the inclusion of Giant Cape to help give even more of an edge. However, most importantly, Bibarel ex is capable of dealing a massive 100 damage per turn whilst also healing itself for 30 HP.

As this does not require unequipping Energies to do so, essentially you will want to set up Bibarel ex and get it into the Active Spot as quickly as possible. Wigglytuff ex makes the perfect supporting Pokemon to play on the bench when Bibarel ex is in the Active Spot, due to the Comforting Song ability. This ability, which can be played once per turn from the bench, can heal 20 damage from your Active Pokemon (Bibarel ex) - therefore giving it even more sustain.

That leaves Manaphy as your early game/lead Pokemon, most importantly due to the Oceanic Gift move. This move requires just one Water Energy to function but equips one Water Energy each to 2 benched Pokemon of your choice - and as both Wigglytuff and Bibarel ex are Colorless Pokemon, they can function with the Water Energy manapy provides. Pretty much, Manaphy can assist in quickly fueling up both Jigglypuff/Wigglytuff and Bidoof/Bibarel to help with your setup and enable you to make a big pivot into dealing heavy damage whilst enabling Bibarel ex to tank incoming hits, outliving the opponent.

Cyrus can force a disruption into your opponent's strategy and set you up for an easy KO. Leaf reduces retreat cost to help you smoothly swap Bibarel ex into play, and Irida assists with even more sustain/HP regeneration, ensuring Bibarel stays in that critical Active Pokemon spot.

item.title: What to Do After Finishing the Main Story in Schedule 1
item.description:
Given that the game is still in the early access stage, it shouldn't come as too much of a surprise to learn that Schedule 1 does not feature much of an endgame. However, that's not to say that there aren't still plenty of things for players to do once they're finished with the game's main story.

The last few quests in Schedule 1 are centered around hiring workers, which players can use to expand and automate their criminal empires. They may also want to think about stockpiling money and resources in preparation for some of the fantastic new content that the developer has planned.

Purchase More Properties

As of the time of writing, there are 10 properties and businesses that players can purchase in Schedule 1 . Legitimate businesses like the Laundromat and Taco Ticklers will allow them to launder their money, while properties like the Barn and Docks Warehouse can be used to grow and manufacture more product.

As the size of their empire expands, players will find themselves in need of more and more space, so it's a good idea to snap up these properties and businesses once they have enough cash. Most can be purchased from Ray's Realty, although one or two, like the Sweatshop and the Motel, are acquired by speaking with the owner.

Automate Your Setup

By hiring Botanists, Chemists, and Packagers, players can use one of the purchasable properties to create their very own farm. As long as they're able to provide all of the raw materials, Botanists will grow their product for them, while Chemists will take charge of the mixing and refinement process.

With packagers moving ingredients around for them, players can automate mixing recipes, providing them with millions of dollars of product while they get on with other things. For multi-ingredient recipes, they just need to have the Chemists take the mixed product over to the next Mixing Station, where they should have a handler place the next ingredient.

Switch Over to the Beta Branch

Thankfully, for those who just can't wait for the next content drop, there's a way to speed things up a little. By switching over to the beta branch of Schedule 1 , players will be able to check out future updates before anybody else while also helping the developer address any potential problems before the update is fully rolled out.

It's still early days at the moment, but most of the beta updates so far have been incredibly stable, so players needn't worry too much about messing up their progress. That said, it's still a good idea to back up your Schedule 1 save file before switching over to the beta branch, just on the off chance that something does go wrong.

Try Out Some Mods

Anyone looking for even more ways to enhance their experience should take a moment to check out some of the many great Schedule 1 mods. Granted, at the moment, most of these tend to focus more on providing quality-of-life updates than they do on introducing new content, but they can still make a massive difference.

There's a mod that provides players with an on-screen mini-map and another that makes it so that employees no longer need beds. There's also a mobile banking app, allowing players to withdraw and deposit cash without having to find an ATM. More Schedule 1 mods are being added every day, so it really is a great way to get a bit more life out of the game.

Stockpile Cash for Future Updates

Money is one of those things that you can never really have enough of, and this definitely holds true here. The official Schedule 1 roadmap lists plenty of big changes and additions that will likely require cash, and dataminers have already found evidence of new properties that players will be able to purchase by digging around inside the game's files.

There's no right or wrong answer when it comes to how much money players should be saving, but as there's an achievement for racking up a net worth of ten million dollars, this seems like as good a place to start as any. While they're at it, players may want to take a moment to unlock all of the other Schedule 1 achievements, assuming they haven't already done so.

item.title: Monopoly GO: How to Add Friends
item.description:
Monopoly GO is a mobile version of the popular board game Monopoly. The game features two dice, and the game proceeds as players roll them to move around the board. The number of dice determines how many tiles a player will move. The game combines strategy and luck, much like the original version.

Since Monopoly GO is a multiplayer game, you can enjoy friendly banter with your friends. However, the process of adding friends can be a bit tricky. Read the following guide to learn how to add friends in Monopoly GO .

Updated on April 12, 2025, by Usama Ali: Monopoly GO is so much better with friends. From the monthly Partners and Tycoon Racers Events to sticker trading and gifting, itâs amazing to team up and help each other out. It really adds a whole social layer to the game that makes collecting stickers and participating in minigames even more satisfying. Scopely has made it even easier to add friends in Monopoly GO, and weâve updated this guide with all the different options.

How to Add Friends in Monopoly GO

There are three ways to add friends in Monopoly GO:

  • Via contact list
  • Through Facebook
  • By sending an invite link
  • By sharing Friend Codes
  • Through Tycoon Cards

While most of these options are accessible through the Friends menu at the bottom right corner of the screen, others require a bit more effort. Hereâs a brief explanation of all the ways you can add friends in Monopoly GO:

Contact List

Connect the contact list of your phone to Monopoly GO and add friends. With this option, players need to share their phone number and access to their contact list. This way, your friends who have just downloaded the game will be automatically added. After linking your contacts with Monopoly GO , you can unlink it by going to the game's permissions.

Facebook

The most convenient method to add friends in Monopoly GO is through Facebook. This saves you the trouble of sending invites to your friends one-by-one. Every friend in your Facebook friend list who plays Monopoly GO will be automatically added. All you need to do is link your Facebook account with Monopoly GO , and the job is done. The more friends you add, the more rewards you reap. This is the perfect option for players who are not comfortable sharing their phone numbers.

Invite Link

If you have friends who haven't tried Monopoly GO , you can send them the invite link. Opening the link will take them to the store page where they can download the game and install it on their phones. Just copy the invite link and share it with your friends on any messaging app. As soon as they install the game, they will be added to your friends list.

Friend Codes

Friend Codes were recently introduced as an alternative to the invite link. Each player has a specific digital ID that makes it easy for others to find and add you directly in the game. You can find your Friend Code at the top of the âAdd Friendsâ tab in the Friends menu. Tap on your code to copy it and then paste it wherever you're chatting with friends.

In that same "Add Friends" tab, you'll see a spot to enter someone else's Friend Code in Monopoly GO . Type it in and hit "Search" to send a friend request.

Tycoon Cards

Tycoon Cards are like mini profiles that give you a snapshot of another player. These cards show off a player's achievements, like their Net Worth, the tokens and shields they're using, and even how active they've been. You can actually peek at someone's Tycoon Card before you send a friend request. This is super handy for seeing if they seem like an active player who'd be a good partner for events or sticker trading.

To view a Tycoon Card, just tap on someone's avatar in the game. You can usually do this from your friends list, the leaderboards, or even when they hit your board with a Shutdown or Bank Heist. Once you've checked out their card, and they seem like a good match, click on the given button to send them a friend request.

Rewards for Inviting Friends in Monopoly GO

By using the contact list method to add friends, players can earn a bonus of 30 free dice as a reward. Similarly, connecting with a Facebook account grants you 25 free dice.

Monopoly Go is available now for PC and Mobile Devices.

item.title: Metro 2033 Redux vs Vanilla Changes and Differences, Explained
item.description:
Metro 2033 is a beloved survival shooter that offers an immersive look at post-apocalyptic Russia, and the enhanced Metro 2033 Redux makes the game even better. Metro 2033 Redux adds quite a few quality of life changes and reworks the campaign structure to make things flow more smoothly.

Metro 2033 was originally released in 2010 for Xbox 360 and PC, and Metro 2033 Redux hit PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC four years later in 2014 alongside an enhanced version of its sequel, Metro: Last Light Redux . The Redux versions of these games are essentially remasters at their core, but they change much more than just visuals.

Metro 2033 Redux Changes and Improvements

The most significant improvement to Metro 2033 Redux is its new engine. The game now runs on the engine of its sequel, Last Light , so several graphical changes, new mechanics, and other features have been ported over.

Because the game runs on Last Light 's engine, players can now wipe their mask and perform takedowns in Metro 2033 Redux among other things. The game features more realistic weapon handling and more accurate firearm features. The game tracks if there is a round currently chambered when reloading guns, for example.

In addition, new difficulty modes are available to choose from. The fan-favorite Ranger mode is included in Metro 2033 Redux , offering a highly immersive experience with lethal tweaks to difficulty. Players can also choose between Spartan and Survival difficulty settings. The former makes the game more action-oriented and increases resource availablity as in Metro: Last Light , while the latter limits the player's supplies and slows the game down as in Metro 2033 .

Metro 2033 Redux also makes multiple big changes to the campaign structure, combining individual levels into long stretches of gameplay without loading screens separating them. The story and missions are still the exact same as the original game, but everything flows more smoothly in Redux .

There are no new levels or areas in Metro 2033 Redux , but some new secrets have been added to the campaign that draw inspiration from Last Light . For example, Redux adds locked safes to some of Metro 2033 's missions. Players can find keys while scavenging that will open these safes and reward them with resources, ammunition, and supplies.

Ultimately, Metro 2033 Redux is an enhanced version of the original game that brings it more in line with the later entries in the Metro series. It's not quite up to the level of something like Metro: Exodus , but Metro 2033 Redux 's fantastic atmosphere and streamlined campaign progression make it a memorable first-person shooter.

item.title: RuneScape: Dragonwilds - How to Claim Early Adopter Bonus Rewards
item.description:
RuneScape: Dragonwilds is now available in early access, and players who purchase the game ahead of its official 1.0 launch will receive some bonus rewards to help them stand out next to everyone else. While the rewards don't offer much in the way of gameplay benefits or buffs, most RuneScape: Dragonwilds players will likely still appreciate the bonus content on offer.

Dragonwilds is a co-op spin-off of the incredibly popular RuneScape , adapting its DNA into a survival adventure in the same vein as Valheim . Players can acquire new gear and craft new items to customize their appearance and furnish their bases, and the early adopter bonuses available during Dragonwilds ' early access period give players a few more ways to express themselves.

RuneScape: Dragonwilds Early Adopter Rewards

These are the rewards available to early adopters who purchase RuneScape: Dragonwilds during early access:

  • Pioneer's Scarf
  • Pioneer's Tapestry
  • Pioneer's Cape
  • Two pieces of music from the game

These rewards will be available throughout the entire early access period, so there's no rush for those who are still on the fence regarding Dragonwilds . The game has plenty of content planned on its roadmap, so players can still claim these early adopter rewards down the line if they'd rather wait for more substantial updates to hit this RuneScape spin-off.

How to Claim Early Adopter Rewards in RuneScape: Dragonwilds

The early adopter rewards aren't just added directly to players' inventories. RuneScape: Dragonwilds is a survival crafting game, so players need to craft their early adopter bonuses themselves.

Thankfully, the recipes for all of the bonus cosmetics are unlocked right from the start of the game. All players need to do is build a crafting table. There, they'll see the Pioneer's Scarf, Pioneer's Cape, and the rest of their early adopter rewards. They have incredibly cheap crafting costs, too, so players won't need to farm a lot of items in order to construct them.

As for the music tracks, those are included as a separate DLC download and are classified as a soundtrack in players' Steam libraries. The music tracks should download automatically when players purchase and install Dragonwilds , but if they don't, the soundtrack can be found in the downloadable content section of the RuneScape: Dragonwilds Steam store page. It's not a full soundtrack, unfortunately, but the two included music tracks are better than nothing at least.

The early adopter rewards don't give players a huge advantage when starting RuneScape: Dragonwilds , but they do provide some minor buffs for beginners thanks to their set bonus perks. Players can enjoy improved stealth speed and more when equipping the Pioneer set, which can make the early stages of survival in RuneScape: Dragonwilds a bit more bearable. These buffs will let players focus more on grinding levels like in Old School RuneScape .
